intro: Cupania costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican cupania, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain several seeds, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Cupania costaricensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
